query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Già era in loco onde s’udia ’l rimbombo 2 de l’acqua che cadea ne l’altro giro, 3 simile a quel che l’arnie fanno rombo,
query.error: **English:** 1 Already I was in the place where one could hear 2 the sound of the water falling into the next circle, 3 similar to the buzzing sound that beehives make,
query.result: 1 Þa wæs ic on ðære stowe ðær ic gehyrde ðone hring 2 ðæs wæteres ðe feoll niðer on ðone ōðerne hring, 3 gelic ðæm swēge ðe beon wyrcað,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 quando tre ombre insieme si partiro, 5 correndo, d’una torma che passava 6 sotto la pioggia de l’aspro martiro.
query.error: **English:** 4 when three shades separated themselves from a group 5 that was running, passing by 6 under the rain of harsh torment.
query.result: 4 ða ða ðreo sceadu togædere siððan ferdon, 5 rynnendum, of ðære menigeo ðe forð gewāt 6 under ðæm regne ðæs heardan tintregum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 Venian ver’ noi, e ciascuna gridava: 8 «Sòstati tu ch’a l’abito ne sembri 9 esser alcun di nostra terra prava».
query.error: **English:** 7 They came towards us, and each one cried out: 8 "Stop, you who seem to us by your clothing 9 to be one of our evil land."
query.result: 7 Hi comon ongean us, and ælc gredde: 8 "Gestand ðu ðe ðe ðurh ðin reaf semest 9 beon sum of ðisse leode lyðre."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Ahimè, che piaghe vidi ne’ lor membri, 11 ricenti e vecchie, da le fiamme incese! 12 Ancor men duol pur ch’i’ me ne rimembri.
query.error: **English:** 10 Alas, what wounds I saw upon their limbs, 11 recent and old, inflicted by the flames! 12 I still grieve merely to recall them.
query.result: 10 Eala, hwæt wunda ic ðær geseah on heora limum, 11 niwe and ealde, ða ða lig tosloh! 12 Þa gyt ic me geomrie þæt ic ðæs geman.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 A le lor grida il mio dottor s’attese; 14 volse ’l viso ver’ me, e «Or aspetta», 15 disse, «a costor si vuole esser cortese.
query.error: **English:** 13 At their cries my guide stopped; 14 he turned his face toward me and said, 15 “Now you must be courteous to these.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 E se non fosse il foco che saetta 17 la natura del loco, i’ dicerei 18 che meglio stesse a te che a lor la fretta».
query.error: **English:** 16 And if it were not for the fire that flashes 17 from the nature of the place, I would say 18 that haste would suit you better than them.
query.result: 16 Andgifhitnærewærefýrðætflíteð 17 ðæs stowesgecynd,icsecganwolde 18 ðætðeðegeðelicewæreðeðeðehimðonneðe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Ricominciar, come noi restammo, ei 20 l’antico verso; e quando a noi fuor giunti, 21 fenno una rota di sé tutti e trei.
query.error: **English:** 19 To begin again, as we had remained, he 20 and the ancient verse; and when they had come to us, 21 they made a circle of themselves, all three.
query.result: 19 On ðam wege ðe we ðær wunedon, he 20 ðone ealdan fers ða eft ongon; and ða ða he to us com, 21 ða worhton ða ðreo ealle ða anre hring.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Qual sogliono i campion far nudi e unti, 23 avvisando lor presa e lor vantaggio, 24 prima che sien tra lor battuti e punti,
query.error: **English:** 22 As naked and oiled wrestlers are accustomed to do, 23 watching for their hold and their advantage, 24 before they are locked together and grappling,
query.result: 22 Swa swa ða campas ðe ðam nægledon nacode and smerede, 23 heora gripe geornlice and heora geþincðu, 24 ær ðam ðe hie tosomne beoð fæste and gebundene,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 così rotando, ciascuno il visaggio 26 drizzava a me, sì che ’n contraro il collo 27 faceva ai piè continüo vïaggio.
query.error: **English:** 25 so, whirling around, each one turned his face 26 toward me, so that his neck made a continual journey 27 in opposition to his feet.
query.result: 25 swa ða deofla ymb ðone deofollican wer drifon, 26 heora neb to ðam menniscan wer gecirdon, 27 and heora fot to ðam deofle.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 la fama nostra il tuo animo pieghi 32 a dirne chi tu se’, che i vivi piedi 33 così sicuro per lo ’nferno freghi.
query.error: **English:** 31 may our fame incline your mind 32 to tell us who you are, who tread through Hell 33 with feet so sure."
query.result: 31 ðin mærð and ðin miht ðinne mod gebigð 32 ðæt ðu us secge hwæt ðu sy, ðe ðus secne weg 33 ofer helle hæð hygeþancas trædst."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Questi, l’orme di cui pestar mi vedi, 35 tutto che nudo e dipelato vada, 36 fu di grado maggior che tu non credi:
query.error: **English:** 34 This one, whose footprints you see me treading on, 35 although he goes naked and hairless, 36 was of greater rank than you think:
query.result: 34 Þes, ðara spor ðu gesihst ðæt ic trede, 35 ðeah ðe he nacod and nægledfæst fare, 36 wæs he hærra ðonne ðu wene:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 nepote fu de la buona Gualdrada; 38 Guido Guerra ebbe nome, e in sua vita 39 fece col senno assai e con la spada.
query.error: **English:** 37 he was the grandson of the good Gualdrada; 38 his name was Guido Guerra, and in his lifetime 39 he accomplished much with his wisdom and his sword.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 L’altro, ch’appresso me la rena trita, 41 è Tegghiaio Aldobrandi, la cui voce 42 nel mondo sù dovria esser gradita.
query.error: **English:** 40 The other, who treads the sand behind me, 41 is Tegghiaio Aldobrandi, whose voice 42 ought to be held in reverence in the world above.
query.result: 40 Se ðe ðær æfter me ða ræge tred, 41 ðæt is Tegghiaio Aldobrandi, ðæs stefn 42 on ðære worulde up sceolde beon geæðmod.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 E io, che posto son con loro in croce, 44 Iacopo Rusticucci fui, e certo 45 la fiera moglie più ch’altro mi nuoce».
query.error: **English:** 43 And I, who am placed with them on the cross, 44 was Iacopo Rusticucci, and truly 45 my fierce wife harms me more than anything else.
query.result: 43 And ic, ðe geset eom mid heom on rode, 44 Iacopo Rusticucci wæs ic haten, and to soðe 45 min reðe wif me mæst dereð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 S’i’ fossi stato dal foco coperto, 47 gittato mi sarei tra lor di sotto, 48 e credo che ’l dottor l’avria sofferto;
query.error: **English:** 46 If I had been covered by the fire, 47 I would have thrown myself among them below, 48 and I believe that the doctor would have tolerated it;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 ma perch’ io mi sarei brusciato e cotto, 50 vinse paura la mia buona voglia 51 che di loro abbracciar mi facea ghiotto.
query.error: **English:** 49 but because I would have been burned and cooked, 50 fear overcame my good will 51 that made me eager to embrace them.
query.result: 49 ac forðæm ic wolde beon forbærned and forswæled, 50 ofercom se ege minne godne willan 51 ðe me dyde gitsere ðæt ic hi wolde clyppan.

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 tosto che questo mio segnor mi disse 56 parole per le quali i’ mi pensai 57 che qual voi siete, tal gente venisse.

query.result: 55 siððan ðis min hlaford me lærde 56 worda ðurh ða ic wende ðæt ge wæron 57 swylce ge syndon, folc ðe ðær com."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 Di vostra terra sono, e sempre mai 59 l’ovra di voi e li onorati nomi 60 con affezion ritrassi e ascoltai.
query.error: **English:** 58 I am from your land, and always 59 I recounted and listened with affection 60 to your work and your honored names.
query.result: 58 Ic eom of ðinum earde, and symle ða 59 ðin weorc and ðine weorðfullan naman 60 mid lufe wrat and hlyste.

70 ché Guiglielmo Borsiere, il qual si duole 71 con noi per poco e va là coi compagni, 72 assai ne cruccia con le sue parole».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 «La gente nuova e i sùbiti guadagni 74 orgoglio e dismisura han generata, 75 Fiorenza, in te, sì che tu già ten piagni».

query.result: 73 Þæt folc niwe and ða færlican gestreon 74 ofermetto and ofermodigað habbað, 75 Florentia, on ðe, swa ðæt ðu ðæt nu bewepast."

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Così gridai con la faccia levata; 77 e i tre, che ciò inteser per risposta, 78 guardar l’un l’altro com’ al ver si guata.

88 Un amen non saria possuto dirsi 89 tosto così com’ e’ fuoro spariti; 90 per ch’al maestro parve di partirsi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 Io lo seguiva, e poco eravam iti, 92 che ’l suon de l’acqua n’era sì vicino, 93 che per parlar saremmo a pena uditi.
query.error: **English:** 91 I followed him, and we had gone but a short distance, 92 when the sound of the water was so close to us, 93 that we would have been scarcely heard if we had spoken.
query.result: 91 Ic him folgode, and we lytle wæron, 92 ðæt ðæs wæteres sōn wæs swa gehende, 93 ðæt we for spræce næron gehýrede.

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 rimbomba là sovra San Benedetto 101 de l’Alpe per cadere ad una scesa 102 ove dovea per mille esser recetto;
query.error: **English:** 100 it thunders there above San Benedetto 101 of the Alps to fall down a slope 102 where it was to be received by a thousand;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 così, giù d’una ripa discoscesa, 104 trovammo risonar quell’ acqua tinta, 105 sì che ’n poc’ ora avria l’orecchia offesa.
query.error: **English:** 103 thus, down from a steep bank, 104 we found that dark water resounding, 105 so that in a short time it would have offended the ear.
query.result: 103 eall swilce, of ðære steapan ripe, 104 we fundon ðæt wæter ðuniende, 105 swa ðæt hit wolde on lytlum fæce ða earan gedrefan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Io avea una corda intorno cinta, 107 e con essa pensai alcuna volta 108 prender la lonza a la pelle dipinta.
query.error: **English:** 106 I had a rope tied around my waist, 107 and with it I thought at one time 108 to catch the leopard with the spotted skin.
query.result: 106 Ic hæfde ræp gebunden ymbe me, 107 and mid ðy ic wende sume hwile 108 ðæt ic ða gesticcedan leoparde gelæhte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Poscia ch’io l’ebbi tutta da me sciolta, 110 sì come ’l duca m’avea comandato, 111 porsila a lui aggroppata e ravvolta.
query.error: **English:** 109 After I had untied it all by myself, 110 just as my guide had commanded me, 111 I handed it to him, knotted and twisted.
query.result: 109 Siððan ic ðæt hæfde eall fram me alysed, 110 swa swa se heretoga me hæfde beboden, 111 ic sealde hit him gecnytt and bewunden.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Ond’ ei si volse inver’ lo destro lato, 113 e alquanto di lunge da la sponda 114 la gittò giuso in quell’ alto burrato.
query.error: **English:** 112 And he turned toward the right side, 113 and somewhat far from the bank 114 he threw her down into that deep ravine.
query.result: 112 And he gewende him to ðæm swiðran healfe, 113 and sum ðel fram ðære ofre 114 he wearp heo niðer on ðone deopan pytt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 ‘E’ pur convien che novità risponda’, 116 dicea fra me medesmo, ‘al novo cenno 117 che ’l maestro con l’occhio sì seconda’.
query.error: **English:** 115 ‘And yet it is fitting that novelty should respond’, 116 I said to myself, ‘to the new sign 117 that the master follows with his eye’.
query.result: 115 ‘And þeah hit is gerisenlic ðæt niwung andsware’, 116 cwæð ic to me sylfum, ‘to ðam niwan tacne 117 ðe se lareow mid ðam eage swa folgað’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Ahi quanto cauti li uomini esser dienno 119 presso a color che non veggion pur l’ovra, 120 ma per entro i pensier miran col senno!
query.error: **English:** 118 Ah, how cautious men should be 119 with those who do not see only the deed, 120 but look with their minds into the thoughts!
query.result: 118 Eala, hu micel sceal mon war wesan 119 wið ða ðe ne geseoð ða weorc ðone, 120 ac ðurh ða ðohtas mid ðam mode lociað!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 El disse a me: «Tosto verrà di sovra 122 ciò ch’io attendo e che il tuo pensier sogna; 123 tosto convien ch’al tuo viso si scovra».
query.error: **English:** 121 He said to me: "Soon will come from above 122 what I await and what your thought dreams of; 123 soon it is fitting that it be revealed to your sight."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Sempre a quel ver c’ha faccia di menzogna 125 de’ l’uom chiuder le labbra fin ch’el puote, 126 però che sanza colpa fa vergogna;
query.error: **English:** 124 Always for that truth which has the face of a lie 125 should a man keep his lips closed as long as he can, 126 because without fault it brings shame;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 ma qui tacer nol posso; e per le note 128 di questa comedìa, lettor, ti giuro, 129 s’elle non sien di lunga grazia vòte,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 ch’i’ vidi per quell’ aere grosso e scuro 131 venir notando una figura in suso, 132 maravigliosa ad ogne cor sicuro,

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 sì come torna colui che va giuso 134 talora a solver l’àncora ch’aggrappa 135 o scoglio o altro che nel mare è chiuso,

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 che ’n sù si stende e da piè si rattrappa.
